entry.title: February 6, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Good. 11:00pm to 8:30am. I did wake up often during the later part of the night.
  • Breakfast: 2 pieces of bacon
  • Lunch: the innards of 3 tacos. This time, it was a mix of potatos, eggs, avocado, spinach, cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms
  • Snacks: walnuts and a few cashews. Because the inside of three tacos isn’t all that much.
  • Dinner: 2 Italian sausages, green beans, tiny potatoes
  • Alcohol: a ounce of Tequila

Rock climbing, you poop me.
My fingers are jello.

I made some friends at the gym.

entry.title: February 5, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Good. 11:30pm to 7:30am. Woot! Eight hours! I did force myself to get out of bed. I could’ve easily fall asleep again for another hour.
  • Breakfast: 3 eggs, one salmon croquette
  • Lunch: 1/4 chicken, veggies
  • Snacks: none
  • Dinner: chips and queso!
  • Alcohol: margarita and a shot of tequila

I ended my work-everyday experiment, but I may have said that already. I can’t remember and I’m too lazy to go back and read my old posts. Anyway, I stopped it not because it was hard to work everyday, but because I felt bad for getting to work after everyone and leaving before anyone else…

I started two online classes: Finance, and Model Thinking. I think these two classes go together like goat cheese and crackers. There are people making a killing creating financial models in the real world everyday. I want to make a killing too.

entry.title: February 4, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Good. 11pm to 8am. I had to force myself not to fall asleep this morning
  • Breakfast: ate the inside of three tacos again this morning. It included a bit of mashed potatoes. Did I ever mention I have a v8 every morning at work?
  • Lunch: double steak Subway salad with guacamole
  • Snacks: walnuts
  • Dinner: 2 salmon croquettes (canned wild salmon, one egg, corn meal) fried in olive oil, mustard greens, coconut oil
  • Alcohol: a small tequila + lime juice

I went rock climbing during lunch and came back hungry. I’m listening to my body!

My knees are bothering me and I blame rock climbing.

entry.title: February 3, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Good. 11pm to 9am.
  • Breakfast: I took three tacos at work, removed the flour tortilla and ate whatever was inside with salsa.
  • Lunch: none
  • Snacks: walnuts
  • Dinner: 1/2lb ground beef, mustard greens, a piece of dark chocolate, coconut oil
  • Alcohol: none

entry.title: February 2, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Ah, finally a good night! I’m sure being sore had something to do with it. 11pm to 8am.
  • Breakfast: Scrambled eggs, a bit of refried beans, half a piece of bacon, a small homemade hashbrown.
  • Lunch: none
  • Snacks: none
  • Dinner: Double bunless cheeseburger at home, a bit of coconut oil, a plate of cheesy nachos.
  • Alcohol: a margarita and some whiskey during the super bowl.

My rock climbing performance wasn’t there yesterday. I struggled on everything I tried and my fingers didn’t want to hold on to much. Considering I took 2 day breaks in between sessions, I can hardly believe that I need more rest. I need to research this more.

I feel bad for eathing those nachos. It was a smallish plate, so I imagine there was about 20-25g of carbs. Not much, but still. I’d lose weight faster without those carbs. I need to go buy healthy snaccks.

entry.title: February 1, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Long, but not continuous. I’m still awefully sore from my abs workout two days ago. I kept waking up all night. 10:00pm to 8:30am
  • Breakfast: two corn tortilla tacos with eggs, beans, chorizo, jalapenos
  • Lunch: flank steak with kale
  • Snacks: smoked salmon, coconut oil, cheese
  • Dinner: sushi (2-3 pieces of a tempura fried one, used soy sauce), miso soup, 3 quail eggs, tuna, daikon radish, mayo of some sort
  • Alcohol: two small glasses of sake

I was hungry all day! I’m not sure why. Maybe it’s because I need to recover from my workouts. Speaking of which… I was so sore today! I still am. My hip flexors are preventing me from standing straight, but my abs are finally getting a bit better.

entry.title: January 31, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Horrible. Couldn’t fall asleep until 11:45pm and woke up at 6:45am. Plus, I tossed and turned all night.
  • Breakfast: 3 eggs, cheese
  • Lunch: none
  • Snacks: none
  • Dinner: 12 oz (ish) flank steak with a bunch of kale cooked with bacon and onions.
  • Alcohol: Tried a new cocktail with gin, Peychaud bitters and lemon bitters, orange juice. It was good. Then I had some whisky.

D

The power core workout I did last night turned my abs into jelly and prevented me from efficiently tossing and turning during the night, which added insult to injury. What a bad night. Last time I ate at Rudy’s I had trouble sleeping that night as well. I need to keep that in mind.

I ate the way I want to eat in the future: just breakfast and dinner. I got a bit hungry, but I knew it wasn’t real hunger and that I could easily last until dinder. This way, I don’t have to waste an hour of work for lunch and I can come home earlier at night.

entry.title: January 30, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Woke up a lot during the night, otherwise sleep was good. 10:30pm to 9am.
  • Breakfast: I needed a big breakfast to last until diner time. 4 eggs, one potato hashbrown. I didn’t even finish my plate.
  • Lunch: none
  • Snacks: none
  • Dinner: Ate diner at 9pm: Rudy’s BBQ. 1/2lb brisket, cole slaw, potato salad, water and NO bread.
  • Alcohol: none

I ate breakfast and headed out to a college recruiting event from 11am to 6pm, after which I went rock climbing. I was there late enough to catch the power core class at 8pm and decided to give it a shot.

entry.title: January 29, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Short and alcohol induced. 1:30am to 9am.
  • Breakfast: a bowl of Cara’s chili
  • Lunch: a chicken salad, with balsamic vinaigrette and dried fruits and nuts
  • Snacks: a few cashews
  • Dinner: Tortilla chips, queso, pork in a salsa verde, a bit of rice
  • Alcohol: a margarita and a shot of tequila

I surprisingly felt good today, but fell apart at around 5pm. I think I’m going to go back to working regular hours. Although I really liked working shorter days everyday, a few things bothered me. First, it’s weird to come in late and leave early. I felt like I had to explain myself to my coworkers every day. Second, having to work on weekends is always a bummer.

I did like all the extra time I had, though. I read a lot more and worked longer on my project. Working full days will mean a lot less of that.

entry.title: January 28, 2014
entry.content:
• Sleep: Good. 10:30pm to 7:45am.
  • Breakfast: 3 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon
  • Lunch: a Frito pie with Cara’s chili, which includes beans. So this was a bit more carb-y than what I usually eat, but it was delicious
  • Snacks: walnuts
  • Dinner: Chicken salad at Athenian! I can’t help myself whenever I’m downtown. Their salad is so good and fits my diet so well that it’s all I ever eat.
  • Alcohol: A few. I went to a user group meeting and at a bar afterwards. I had 3 whiskey drinks (paid for by the user group sponsor) and one cocktail (paid for by a good friend of mine.) Sleep will suffer…

I need to go to these user groups more often and get the pulse of the community. The only times I go is when I’m looking for jobs or to see my friend Scott talk. I realized that the reason I stopped going was that I hardly learn anything new anymore, or nothing I can’t learn from a blog post anyway. So I’ve decided that I need to start teaching.

I’ll focus my area of teaching around the structure of software and start with the basic SOLID principles.
